solution_line_template: Since there are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in an hour, then Mr. Willson worked for {minutes_per_hour} minutes x {monday_fraction} = <<{minutes_per_hour}*{monday_fraction}={monday_minutes}>>{monday_minutes} minutes on Monday.
He worked for {minutes_per_hour} minutes/{tuesday_divisor} = <<{minutes_per_hour}/{tuesday_divisor}={tuesday_minutes}>>{tuesday_minutes} minutes on Tuesday.
He worked for {minutes_per_hour} minutes x {wednesday_fraction} = <<{minutes_per_hour}*{wednesday_fraction}={wednesday_minutes}>>{wednesday_minutes} minutes on Wednesday.
He worked for {minutes_per_hour} minutes x {thursday_fraction} = <<{minutes_per_hour}*{thursday_fraction}={thursday_minutes}>>{thursday_minutes} minutes on Thursday.
So Mr. Willson worked for {monday_minutes} + {tuesday_minutes} + {wednesday_minutes} + {thursday_minutes} + {friday_minutes} = <<{total_minutes}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes.
In hours, it is equal to {total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours.
